crypto

Class FileAdministrator

  • java.lang.Object
    • crypto.FileAdministrator

  • public class FileAdministrator
extends java.lang.Object
    Permits to manage a file after deciphering (require password). Require a Encryptor and a Decryptor for the File and the Strings, the name of the file and a empty HashMap
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Florent LACROIX & Laetitia GAIGNIER
    See Also:
    Encryptor, Decryptor, FileScreen, ConnectionScreen

      FileAdministrator()

    • Method Detail

      • openFile

        public java.util.HashMap<byte[],byte[]> openFile(java.lang.String file,
                                        java.lang.String password)
        Permits to open a encrypted file, if the password is correct
        Parameters:
        file - Name of the file
        password - Password to decipher the file
        Returns:
        The HashMap deciphered, with the encrypted data of some ID and password

      • getHashMap

        public java.util.HashMap<byte[],byte[]> getHashMap()
        Return the HashMap who contains the data of the deciphered file
        Returns:
        The HashMap deciphered, data of FileAdministrator

      • setHashMapToNull

        public void setHashMapToNull()
        Set the HashMap who contains the data of the deciphered file to NULL

      • search

        public java.lang.String search(java.lang.String id)
        Search a key in the HashMap
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the pair id-password to find in the HashMap
        Returns:
        The password deciphered if the id pass in parameter exists, NULL otherwise
        See Also:
        FileScreen, Decryptor

      • add

        public boolean add(java.lang.String id,
          java.lang.String password)
        Add a pair ID-password to the HashMap and push it in the encrypted file
        Parameters:
        id - ID to the pair ID-password to add at the HashMap
        password - Password to the pair ID-password to add at the HashMap
        Returns:
        TRUE if the pair is add to the HashMap, FALSE otherwise
        See Also:
        FileScreen, Encryptor, Decryptor

      • delete

        public boolean delete(java.lang.String id)
        Delete a pair ID-password of the HashMap and update the encrypted file
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the pair to delete
        Returns:
        TRUE if the pair is deleted, FALSE otherwise
        See Also:
        FileScreen, Decryptor

        public void putHashMapInFile()
        Put the HashMap in the encrypted file
